column4: Thank you ubuntu for whipping my thumbdrive with out telling me...
not to disappoint, ubuntu didnt do it. you did it. ubuntu asked you if you wanted to do it lol

I was installing grub using the grub-install, which I've asked multiple times for help and now I finally get it to work by just telling it to install on /dev/sdb and now my filetype is RAW, so no it did not tell me that it was going to render it usless.
in grub, your disks should have been laid out in a format that was readable by size. you didnt view what you were writing to prior to doing so?
I have, but grub wouldn't install onto it, so I figured that I might as well try sdb and well it worked, and rendered it useless
im really sorry that it rendered it useless. ive done a similar thing before, but realized it, and fixed it. i hope it didnt kill any data on it that was of real importance like family pics and stuff
well it killed my report, but luckly EASEUS recovers the entire partition, but do you think you can help me once I fix my pendrive?
will you be on in about 30 minutes, I have to recover the partition
i may. there are alot more intelligent people on here than me tho when it comes to that im sure. but, i will help if i see you
what exactly are you doing so i understand it
well I've asked multiple times but no one has offered to help
I'm trying to install Grub2 onto my pendrive, using grub-install, but I keep getting: "Cannot find a GRUB device for /dev/sdb1"
i understand that, but for what? are you trying to install a portable linux distro?
I'm going to use it to run multiple livecds
ah. so you are going to be able to boot several versions of linux/windows on a portable... i get it
